definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: If you hand-write your responses, please write legibly.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是手写答案，请字迹工整。

sentences.english: Extracting and interpreting the seismic velocity spectrum data manually is kind of tedious work.
sentences.chinese: 人工整理地震速度谱资料是比较繁琐的。

sentences.english: He carefully wrote his name on the flyleaf.
sentences.chinese: 他把自己的名字工工整整地写在书的衬页上。

sentences.english: This algorithm can extract handwritten Chinese characters stroke for formal Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 该算法可对书写工整的汉字进行有效笔划提取。

sentences.english: Fill the blanks in there sentences, then write them neatly.
sentences.chinese: 给些句子填空，然后工整地抄写下来。

sentences.english: The Cold War are over, the gang Lao Gui's passion is also so neat how?
sentences.chinese: 冷战都结束了，这帮老鬼的激情怎么还那么工整？

sentences.english: You fill the blanks in these sentences, then write them neatly.
sentences.chinese: 把句子中的空添上，然后工整的抄写下来。

sentences.english: The biggest selling point of crystal is not only in the purity, but also in the gorgeous cut.
sentences.chinese: 其最大的卖点就是晶体之纯净与切割之华丽工整。

sentences.english: Please write neatly so that I can ead it.
sentences.chinese: 请把字写得工整些，以便我能认识。

sentences.english: All entries should be legibly written or typewritten.
sentences.chinese: 所有提名表格必须工整书写或用打字机填写。

sentences.english: The style of Dryden is capricious and varied, that of Pope is cautious and uniform;
sentences.chinese: 德莱顿的文风随性多变，蒲柏则谨慎工整。

sentences.english: More delicate than the historians' are the map-makers' colors.
sentences.chinese: 地图工的色彩比历史学家的要更工整。

sentences.english: It was cleanly typed, single-spaced, and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 那封信打字工整清晰，行间留一行距离，切中要点。

sentences.english: It is the number of words is not restricted, but the requirement antithesis neat, tonal harmony.
sentences.chinese: 它字数多少不限，但要求对偶工整，平仄协调。

definition: according to a pattern/regular/orderly/structured/neat and tidy
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
lit. not even one stroke is negligent (idiom)/fig. to write characters (calligraphy) in which every stroke is placed perfectly
